description: Returns information about one or more Amazon Lightsail buckets. The information returned includes the synchronization status of the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) account-level block public access feature for your Lightsail buckets. For more information about buckets, see Buckets in Amazon Lightsail in the Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide.

parameters.name: bucketName
parameters.description: The name of the bucket for which to return information. When omitted, the response includes all of your buckets in the Amazon Web Services Region where the request is made.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: The token to advance to the next page of results from your request. To get a page token, perform an initial GetBuckets request. If your results are paginated, the response will return a next page token that you can specify as the page token in a subsequent request.

nested_items.name: buckets
nested_items.description: An array of objects that describe buckets.

nested_items.name: resourceType
nested_items.description: The Lightsail resource type of the bucket.

nested_items.name: accessRules
nested_items.description: An object that describes the access rules of the bucket.

nested_items.name: getObject
nested_items.description: Specifies the anonymous access to all objects in a bucket.

public - Sets all objects in the bucket to public (read-only), making them readable by anyone in the world. If the getObject value is set to public, then all objects in the bucket default to public regardless of the allowPublicOverrides value.

private - Sets all objects in the bucket to private, making them readable only by you or anyone you give access to. If the getObject value is set to private, and the allowPublicOverrides value is set to true, then all objects in the bucket default to private unless they are configured with a public-read ACL. Individual objects with a public-read ACL are readable by anyone in the world.

nested_items.name: allowPublicOverrides
nested_items.description: A Boolean value that indicates whether the access control list (ACL) permissions that are applied to individual objects override the getObject option that is currently specified.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket.

nested_items.name: bundleId
nested_items.description: The ID of the bundle currently applied to the bucket.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the distribution was created.

nested_items.name: url
nested_items.description: The URL of the bucket.

nested_items.name: availabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone. Follows the format us-east-2a (case-sensitive).

nested_items.name: regionName
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region name.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the bucket.

nested_items.name: supportCode
nested_items.description: The support code for a bucket. Include this code in your email to support when you have questions about a Lightsail bucket. This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.

nested_items.name: tags
nested_items.description: The tag keys and optional values for the bucket. For more information, see Tags in Amazon Lightsail in the Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: objectVersioning
nested_items.description: Indicates whether object versioning is enabled for the bucket.
Enabled - Object versioning is enabled.
Suspended - Object versioning was previously enabled but is currently suspended. Existing object versions are retained.
NeverEnabled - Object versioning has never been enabled.

nested_items.name: ableToUpdateBundle
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the bundle that is currently applied to a bucket can be changed to another bundle.

nested_items.name: readonlyAccessAccounts
nested_items.description: An array of strings that specify the Amazon Web Services account IDs that have read-only access to the bucket.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: resourcesReceivingAccess
nested_items.description: An array of objects that describe Lightsail instances that have access to the bucket.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the Lightsail instance.

nested_items.name: resourceType
nested_items.description: The Lightsail resource type (for example, Instance).

nested_items.name: code
nested_items.description: The state code of the bucket.
OK - The bucket is in a running state.
Unknown - Creation of the bucket might have timed-out. You might want to delete the bucket and create a new one.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: A message that describes the state of the bucket.

nested_items.name: accessLogConfig
nested_items.description: An object that describes the access log configuration for the bucket.

nested_items.name: enabled
nested_items.description: A Boolean value that indicates whether bucket access logging is enabled for the bucket.

nested_items.name: destination
nested_items.description: The name of the bucket where the access logs are saved. The destination can be a Lightsail bucket in the same account, and in the same Amazon Web Services Region as the source bucket.

nested_items.name: prefix
nested_items.description: The optional object prefix for the bucket access log.

nested_items.name: nextPageToken
nested_items.description: The token to advance to the next page of results from your request.

nested_items.name: accountLevelBpaSync
nested_items.description: An object that describes the synchronization status of the Amazon S3 account-level block public access feature for your Lightsail buckets.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the account-level BPA synchronization.
InSync - Account-level BPA is synchronized. The Amazon S3 account-level BPA configuration applies to your Lightsail buckets.
NeverSynced - Synchronization has not yet happened. The Amazon S3 account-level BPA configuration does not apply to your Lightsail buckets.
Failed - Synchronization failed. The Amazon S3 account-level BPA configuration does not apply to your Lightsail buckets.
Defaulted - Synchronization failed and account-level BPA for your Lightsail buckets is defaulted to active.

nested_items.name: lastSyncedAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp of when the account-level BPA configuration was last synchronized. This value is null when the account-level BPA configuration has not been synchronized.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: A message that provides a reason for a Failed or Defaulted synchronization status.

SYNC_ON_HOLD - The synchronization has not yet happened. This status message occurs immediately after you create your first Lightsail bucket. This status message should change after the first synchronization happens, approximately 1 hour after the first bucket is created.

DEFAULTED_FOR_SLR_MISSING - The synchronization failed because the required service-linked role is missing from your Amazon Web Services account. The account-level BPA configuration for your Lightsail buckets is defaulted to active until the synchronization can occur. This means that all your buckets are private and not publicly accessible. For more information about how to create the required service-linked role to allow synchronization, see Using Service-Linked Roles for Amazon Lightsail in the Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide.

DEFAULTED_FOR_SLR_MISSING_ON_HOLD - The synchronization failed because the required service-linked role is missing from your Amazon Web Services account. Account-level BPA is not yet configured for your Lightsail buckets. Therefore, only the bucket access permissions and individual object access permissions apply to your Lightsail buckets. For more information about how to create the required service-linked role to allow synchronization, see Using Service-Linked Roles for Amazon Lightsail in the Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide.
Unknown - The reason that synchronization failed is unknown. Contact Amazon Web ServicesSupport for more information.

nested_items.name: bpaImpactsLightsail
nested_items.description: A Boolean value that indicates whether account-level block public access is affecting your Lightsail buckets.
